Posts.Content: Marykak wrote: have any of you had to choose between focused vs whole breast radiation.  I am recently diagnosed lobular, stage 1.  Post lobectomy, 8mm tumor removed.  The oncologist I consulted told me about focused radiation, did not recommend it as he has little research, he recommends whole breast.  I like the idea than ks Maryof focused radiation, looking for an help I can get in this decision.    Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: focused radiation vs whole brest radiation Marykak Nitsana

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2008 10:57AM Marykak wrote: Well I started this and then I kind of tuned out the world for a week.  So far two Oncologist consults recommend full, one radiation onc recommends whole (his center only offers whole)  and my surgeon recommend partial.  My head is spinning.  Being in heath care I rationally think that the partial makes the most sense, even if the studies are not long term.  Those against focused tell me not to mess around, I am young and lucky.  My tumor was found early, 8mm, lobular, all nodes negative, hur 2 negative and er positive.  So I am very confused.  I am meeting with a study coordinator and a radiation oncologist at the center that does both tomorrow, Hopefully I will make a decision.  I have been on the other side of the bed for 27 years, I do not like this side!  I know I value compassion and honesty, but somehow I am goint to step up infusing this into my nursing students!  Mary K
